panels.description:
HELP node_disk_io_now = The number of I/Os currently in progress.
The only field that should go to zero. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate struct request_queue and decremented as they finish
panels.title: Disk I/Os

seriesOverrides.alias: Processes blocked waiting for I/O to complete

panels.description:
node_filesystem_readonly = Filesystem read-only status.
 node_filesystem_device_error = Whether an error occurred while getting statistics for the given device.
panels.title: Filesystem (Readonly)

panels.description:
node_filesystem_files = Filesystem total file nodes.
node_filesystem_files_free = Filesystem total free file nodes.
panels.title: Filesystem (Inodes)

panels.description: “weighted_io_time” might give the more accurate representation of how heavily disks are being used; it multiplies the time waited by a process, by the total number of processes waiting. However we need to use “io_time” in order to calculate a percentage or we would have to factor in the number of processes running at a given time. If there are multiple disks on a system, we are displaying the disk with the greatest IO as we are trying to spot issues so we only need to consider the busiest device. Finally we need to divide by 1000 to convert to seconds and multiply by 100 to get a percentage.
panels.title: Disk I/O weighted time

panels.description: node_scrape_collector_duration_seconds = Duration of a collector scrape.
panels.title: Node Exporter Scrape Time / Collector (s)

panels.description:
node_scrape_collector_success = Whether a collector succeeded.
1 = OK
panels.title: Node Exporter Scrape Counter / Collector Success
